title: Godzilla-Powered Superformance GT40 Mk I
description: This Superformance GT40 is a left-hand-drive Mk I example that was ordered approximately two years before arriving in the US as a rolling chassis in January 2024. The car was purchased by the owner in March 2024 and was subsequently completed by Jo’s Garage in Pompano Beach, Florida, with the installation of a 7.3-liter Godzilla V8 that features dry-sump lubrication, eight-stack fuel injection, and a Callies camshaft. Finished in a Gulf livery, the car is equipped with a Quaife five-speed manual transaxle, Wilwood slotted and ventilated disc brakes, Bilstein adjustable coilover shock absorbers, variable power steering, a front-end lift system, staggered-width 15” Halibrand-style wheels with orange-painted spokes, a “bundle of snakes” exhaust system, black seat upholstery with ventilation grommets, air conditioning, Willans harnesses, and Gulf-livery-themed gauges. After its completion in October 2024, the car was showcased at the 2024 SEMA and PRI shows. This Superformance Mk I is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a clean Florida title in the owner’s name, listing it as a 1969 Ford.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a Godzilla-Powered Superformance GT40 Mk I at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #196,380.
text: This Superformance GT40 is a left-hand-drive Mk I example that was ordered approximately two years before arriving in the US as a rolling chassis in January 2024. The car was purchased by the owner in March 2024 and was subsequently completed by Jo’s Garage in Pompano Beach, Florida, with the installation of a 7.3-liter Godzilla V8 that features dry-sump lubrication, eight-stack fuel injection, and a Callies camshaft. Finished in a Gulf livery, the car is equipped with a Quaife five-speed manual transaxle, Wilwood slotted and ventilated disc brakes, Bilstein adjustable coilover shock absorbers, variable power steering, a front-end lift system, staggered-width 15” Halibrand-style wheels with orange-painted spokes, a “bundle of snakes” exhaust system, black seat upholstery with ventilation grommets, air conditioning, Willans harnesses, and Gulf-livery-themed gauges. After its completion in October 2024, the car was showcased at the 2024 SEMA and PRI shows. This Superformance Mk I is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a clean Florida title in the owner’s name, listing it as a 1969 Ford. Wrapped over an electro-galvanized steel monocoque-style frame with a pressed-steel roof structure, the fiberglass bodywork is finished in a pale blue and orange Gulf livery in the style of the 1968 and 1969 Le Mans-winning Ford GT40 Mk I. Features include a single-vent hood panel flanked by NACA ducts, faired-in headlights and fog lamps, quick-jack bumperettes, a driver-side Gurney bubble, plexiglass side windows with pop-out vents, a Kamm tail, and inverted side air scoops. According to the seller the car has been ceramic coated. Halibrand-style 15″ wheels with orange-painted spokes are secured by three-eared knock-offs and are wrapped in Avon tires measuring 215/60 up front and 295/50 at the rear. Stopping is handled by disc brakes with Wilwood calipers, slotted and ventilated rotors, and dual master cylinders. The car is equipped with variable power steering and a hydraulic nose-lift system. The left-hand-drive cockpit is trimmed in black microsuede with ventilation grommets on the seating surfaces. Additional equipment includes Willans four-point harnesses, black carpeting, a central shifter, and air conditioning. The Moto-Lita steering wheel sits on a quick-release hub ahead of instrumentation including an 8k-rpm tachometer and a 200-mph speedometer with Gulf-livery style dial faces bearing “GT40 7.3” script. The digital odometer indicates 125 miles. Ancillary gauges with pale-blue dial faces monitor oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, fuel level, and voltage. The 7.3-liter Godzilla V8 and its dry-sump lubrication system were supplied by Indy Power Products and installed by Jo’s Garage in Florida. Features include an Innov8 eight-stack fuel-injection system and intake manifold, OBR engine management with a stand-alone ECU and drive-by-wire controls, a Callies camshaft, an Auto Verdi three-stage oil pump, a billet front engine cover, billet aluminum valves covers, and a billet oil pan. The sequentially paired “bundle of snakes” exhaust system incorporates stainless-steel stepped header tubes, crossover collectors, and 3.5” resonators. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a Quaife five-speed manual transaxle. Suspension incorporates Bilstein coilover shock absorbers with H&R springs and anti-roll bars at front and rear.
